answers.answer: I typed in thumb numb, after shower on google & your entry was the first.  Mine just started about a month ago, and same thing on tests.  I do have RA (Rheumatoid arthritis) but that has been kind of eliminated as the cause.  I do hope you find an answer...I shower late at night, 11:55 & I just got out of the shower.  I either notice mine goes away during the night or I stop noticing it about an hour after shower.  It isn't painful, just irritating.I hope you (we) find a simple answer...:)Good luck!- KJ

I feel bad for both of you.The only thing I could find was nerve damage.Have either of you ever had frostbite or near frostbite?Either of you ever have a broken finger, wrist, arm? Any neck or back injuries?Sometimes arthritis can cause odd symptoms, as well as diabetes.
Kj,A partial solution I found is just using the affected arm less in the shower.Next time you shower, try to keep the affected arm down and not use it at all if possible.Tell me if it helped.Cheers.

question: The fingertip of a middle finger on my left hand is tingling for about 30 minies after every shower I take.It started 4 months ago and happens consistently after every shower.I shower twice a day, morning and night and it happens both times.I tried to use slightly different water temperatures, change soaps but it didn't help.The tingling starts after a few minutes in the shower and continues about 30 minutes after the shower.The only thing that seems to eliminate it is covering the fingertip with finger sleeve during the showers.I saw my doctor and did a lot of different blood tests and carpal tunnel tests which all came back ok.Anyone has an idea what it could be and how to treat it?
title: Tingling fingertip after shower
